Sir, I have the honour to refer to letter No .NAD. 323.1608 dated 6th September, 1944, addressed by you to the Direotor of Customs and Port Officer, Bahrain Government, in which you requested exemption from Customs duties on stores and equipment imported by the Corporation into Bahrain on the grounds that the Corporation is now controlled by His Majesty^ Government and operates as a Government service. Sxemption from Customs duties on aircraft equipment etc. was granted by the ShaiJch of Bahrain under the Civil Air Agreement made between him and the British Government on Ist January, 1942. The period of the Agreement was for seven years. Exemp tion from Customs duties was granted in respect of certain specified imports which are fully described in the Agreement. When the Civil Air Agreement was made the British Overseas Airways Corporation had for almost two years been under thi disposal of the Secretary of State for Air. No special exemption from Customs duties on imports by the British Over seas Airways Corporation was demanded or granted at that time. The Bahrain Government is aware that air traffic is controlled by the Secretary of State for Air in the same way that shipping is controlled by the Ministry of War Transport. The Bahrain Government is not however prepared to agree that because the British Overseas Airways Corporation is now under Government control it should therefore be exempted from normal Customs duties upon goods which are imported by the Corporation into Bahrain. I have the honour to be. Sir, Your most obedient servant. Adviser to the Government.No. 35% -7/15 Political Agency, Bahrain The 29th November, 1944. titleInfo.title: 'File 7/15 British Overseas Airways Corporation [BOAC] - Customs Exemption'

physicalDescription.extent: This file is arranged approximately in chronological order.

Foliation: The foliation sequence runs from the first page following the front cover until the back cover of the page. It appears in pencil in the top right corner of the folio.Condition: Text missing on folio 1 due to tear.

mods.abstract: This file contains correspondence between Major Tom Hickinbotham, Political Agent at Bahrain; Lieutenant-Colonel Charles Geoffrey Prior, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bahrain; Charles Dalrymple Belgrave, Adviser to the Bahrain Government; G H C Lee, Assistant Regional Director, British Overseas Airways Corporation (BOAC), Karachi. The correspondence concerns customs exemptions for BOAC stores and equipment imported into Bahrain. Details of the First, Second and Third Civil Air Agreements (1934, 1938 and 1941 respectively) appear in the Office Notes (f. 11).
